bibl.title: Letter from Rupert Blue to Henry Rose Carter, October 28, 1915

div1.p: Blue orders Carter to investigate a fever outbreak in San Juan, Puerto Rico.

div1.head: Letter from Rupert Blue to Henry Rose Carter, October 28, 1915
div1.opener:
JKC
OFFICE OF THE SURGEON GENERAL
IN REPLYING
ADDRESS THE SURGEON GENERAL
U. S. PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
TREASURY DEPARTMENT
BUREAU OF
THE PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
WASHINGTON
October 28, 1915.
WMT
Assistant Surgeon-General Henry R. Carter,
U. S. Public Health Service.
Marine Hospital, Baltimore.
Sir:
div1.p:
Bureau telegram of the 26th instant is hereby con-
firmed as follows:

“Report at Bureau Thursday morning.
Secure passage sailing New York for San Juan,
Porto Rico, next Saturday, as inspector, on
New York and Porto Rico Steamship Lines.”

Upon completion of the conference at the Bureau,
you will return to Baltimore, Maryland. You will then
take the first steamer for San Juan, P.R., for the pur-
pose of inspecting the operations of the Service at the
various ports, of that Island. You will make a careful
investigation of the reported epidemic of fever prevail-
ing in San Juan and vicinity, with a view to establish-
ing the diagnosis and prevention of that disease.

Blank forms have been mailed you at San Juan, P.R.
upon which to make your inspection reports. In your
reports you are to deal with all questions concerning
--2--
economy and efficiency of the administration of the quar-
antine service in Porto Rico, and you will instruct the
officers in any manner which appears necessary.

Should you find it necessary, you are authorized and
directed to proceed to Venezuelan ports and vicinities
for the purpose of acquiring familiarity with the sanitary
status of those ports, with special reference to yellow
fever and plague, and the possibility of their introduc-
tion into Porto Rico and the United States. Your report
should include recommendations as to the continuance of
the present quarantine procedures against that country,
or any inaugurations or modifications of measures which
may seem necessary as the result of your observation.

In communicating with the Bureau you are authorized
to use the new Service Code when necessary.

Upon completion of your duties under these orders,
you will rejoin your station at Baltimore, Maryland.
div1.closer:
Respectfully, Rupert Blue.
Surgeon-General. AnS
WES
The expenses incurred in carrying out the foregoing
instructions are hereby authorized.
WMalburn
M
Assistant Secretary.
ACg
